channel.title: fdisk on Silviu's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in fdisk on Silviu's Blog

item.title: Removed ntfs partition reappears
item.description: So, I was repartitioning a harddrive that used to be a windows disk. I removed the ntfs partition that was spanning the whole drive and created a linux layout instead (two linux partitions and one swap). After writing the partition table the first partition on the disk failed to format. Returning to fdisk I saw that the first partition was still of type NTFS. So I changed the type once more and wrote the partition table to disk.
